com.example.myurbanflix

Class MovieReview

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.myurbanflix.MovieReview

  • public class MovieReview
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines a Movie Review for the purpose of pushing a review remotely to the database; The DB is able to parse Java objects, and thus we pass to it review objects generated in the CreateReviewActivity for it to parse and use to populate a firestore document containing the related data.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      java.lang.String contents
      for holding the body of the review
      java.lang.String dateCreated
      for holding the date that the review was created by the user
      int downvotes
      fod holding the number of downvotes in the review
      java.lang.String movieName
      For holding the review's movie name
      java.lang.String movieNameLower
      For holding the review's movie name (lowercase - for ignoring case)
      java.lang.String reviewTitle
      for holding the title of the review
      int upvotes
      for holding the number of upvotes in the review
      java.lang.String userName
      for holding the username of the author of the review

    • Constructor Detail

      • MovieReview

        public MovieReview()
        No argument constructor to allow for deserialization

      • MovieReview

        public MovieReview(java.lang.String revName,
                   java.lang.String mName,
                   java.lang.String un,
                   java.lang.String date,
                   java.lang.String cont)
        Normal constructor takes all relevant string fields pulled from create review activity and uses them to populate the internal fields. Additionally, sets upvotes to 1 (assumes user will upvote their own review) and downvotes to 0. Keys are provided by the database
        Parameters:
        revName -
        mName -
        un -
        date -
        cont -
